column4: I cannot see any of the pictures located on my sdb1 drive, but i know they are there because they were put in there using xp.  any help would be great
can you see the files using nautilus?
negative Slart_
do you get some kind of error message when you try? do you see anything on the drive at all? what kind of drive is it? regular ntfs? not a dynamic disk?
no error messages come up, all pictures are sorted into folders, cannot see any contents, ntfs drive, 250gb in ext usb casing
are there any errors in the syslog?
tail -n 20 /var/log/syslog will show you the last 20 lines
slart_: nothing looks like an error about my pics

ok.. try doing this.. disconnect the drive (it was an external drive, right?), open a terminal and run this "tail -f -n 0 /var/log/syslog".. now connect the drive again and check that terminal window.. you should have a couple of new lines there now.. use pastebin to paste those lines
!pastebin | mattgman
http://pastebin.com/m5d2af9e8
hmm.. there is an error about VCN there at the end.. that might have something to do with it..
slart_: you want me to go further?
have you run a chkdsk in windows on the drive?
nah, that's alright
slart_: nope
slart_: how do i do a chkdsk?
or scandisk or whatever it's called in windows
slart_: i dont have windows on, full ubuntu
ubuntu (or linux for that matter) doesn't come with a checkdisk utility for ntfs
slart_: i don't want to go back to windows, but if i must to get my pictures (use them for work)
you might be able to access the drive from a vm.. or just find any windows computer to borrow for the time it takes to do the scandisk

I'm not even sure that error is what is causing your files to disappear.. I've never seen it before though.. and googling for it seems to generate a lot of hits for threads where people are having hardware problems
